title: Composition vs Inheritance
subject: React
theory:
## Design Patterns
React has a powerful composition model.

### Containment
Some components don't know their children ahead of time (Sidebar, Dialog). Use `props.children`.

### Specialization
Defining a component as being a 'special case' of another. E.g., `WelcomeDialog` is a special `Dialog`.
Instead of extending classes, `WelcomeDialog` renders `<Dialog title="Welcome" />`.
exam_notes: Facebook uses React in thousands of components and hasn't found a single use case for inheritance.
summary: React forces you to think in terms of Composition, resulting in more flexible code.
